title: Redemption is so fking stupid
body:
2100 gold
94% cost efficient
giving hp to squishy enchanters
can be cast while being death
heals for 490 for every single ally in it, can heal up to 2000 hp nearly
deals %hp true damage
has a zyra ulti aoe size
is also built on champions like {{champion:64}} {{champion:427}} 


who the fuck thought it was a good idea?

> [{quoted}](name=playfive Koopska,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eBjIzBWY,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-11-27T18:34:26.653+0000)
> can be cast while being death


triggered
People forget that when a support item becomes too good it completely outclasses all other items in the game. That's why supports are balanced around low cost low stat items.

As usual, the attempts to give supports useful items ends with them being abused by other lanes...

Nothing to see here. I'm not happy, but I'm also not surprised. I hope this catalyses some talk about reworking the support class.
Abused by other lanes...?  Its broken on everyone, including supports.  They introduced an item that was way too good.

This item can potentially heal 2450 health, without factoring in runic armor + windspeakers blessing + healing/shielding power passives. The true damage and usability while dead are nothing compared to the crazy amount of healing this thing can put out. The true damage isn't an issue because it has a delay.

Redemption makes Knight's vow look like total shit, and Knight's Vow is a pretty damn good item. If redemption remains the same I predict (and I am not the first person to predict this by any means) that we will see junglers purchasing it in competitive. Who in the world designed this item and what in the world went through their head when doing so?  

Giving supports busted items like redemption because its the least popular role is not the way to address that, and lack of ability to make an impact is absolutely not the reason most people who don't play support don't want to do so anyway. It's because playing support inherently involves setting up others to carry, and most people would rather be in a position where they have the resources to enable themselves to carry. Quite honestly the support role is in a great spot, and it will be in an even better spot when they add another mechanic to prevent them from being underleveled for warding.

And why the hell did they make it useable while dead anyway? Pretty much says screw you to the concept of positioning.
you guys realize this is just a 10% max health heal??? So it helps out tanks more than it does. and its damage is based on level... maybe read what it does before bitching about it?

The damage is 10% max HP.
After 2.5 second, call down a beam of light to heal allies for 150 - 490 (based on target's level)
